Job Summary:

The Product Manager is tasked with overseeing the design, development, and management of specific products or a group of products. This role encompasses activities ranging from product definition and planning to production and go-to-market strategies. The Product Manager plays a crucial role in defining the roadmap for their product(s), essential for achieving targets related to bookings, client NPS, and gross margin within their component.

They collaborate with internal stakeholders, clients, and prospects to identify new product capability requirements aimed at driving organic growth. Close cooperation with development teams ensures the successful creation and introduction of these new capabilities to the market. Additionally, the Product Manager takes on the responsibility of testing and deploying these fresh features with clients, while also promoting future growth to a wider audience of CW clients and prospects.

Responsibilities:

  • Owns a product in the Clearwater system.
  • Prioritizes and manages the backlog for their product.
  • Defines requirements for feature development.
  • Collaborates with their development team on the design and building of features & ensures the team understands the business value of features.
  • Defines the product roadmap for their product and contributes to the broader company roadmap.
  • Communicates regularly about the roadmap and upon release of functionality.
  • Speaks with clients about their product’s use case and future needs.
  • Measures success of new feature releases.

Required Skills:

  • Fluent in at least one modern programming language such as JavaScript, C#, C++, Java.
  • Proficiency using modern web development technologies and techniques, including (HTML5, CSS, JavaScript).
  • Strong computer skills, including proficiency in Microsoft Office.
  • Excellent attention to detail and strong documentation skills.
  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.
  • Strong organizational and interpersonal skills.
  • Exceptional problem-solving abilities.

Education and Experience:

  • Bachelors/masters degree in engineering or a related field.
  • 4+ years of relevant experience.
  • Strong knowledge of Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design and problem solving.
  • Experience in implementing and consuming large-scale web services.
  • Experience in full system design and architecture.
  • Experience with database scaling and design.
  • Relational database experience (e.g., MSSQL, Oracle, MySQL).

Description

Position Overview: As a Product Manager in an e-commerce company, your role is to lead the development and management of digital products and services offered on the companys platform. You will be responsible for driving the product strategy, defining product features and requirements, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure successful product launches and ongoing optimization.

Key Responsibilities:

Product Strategy and Vision:

  • Develop and articulate a clear product vision and strategy aligned with the companys goals and market opportunities.
  • Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify customer needs, market trends, and product gaps.
  • Define and prioritize product features and roadmap based on customer feedback, data insights, and business objectives.

Product Development and Execution:

  • Work closely with design, engineering, and other teams to translate product requirements into actionable plans and deliverables.
  • Define user stories, create wireframes, prototypes, and specifications to guide the development process.
  • Collaborate with development teams to ensure timely and high-quality product releases.

Cross-Functional Collaboration:

  • Coordinate with stakeholders across the organization, including marketing, sales, customer support, and operations, to align product strategies and goals.
  • Collaborate with designers and user experience experts to create intuitive and user-friendly product experiences.
  • Engage with data analysts to track product performance, gather insights, and make data-driven decisions.

Product Launch and Adoption:

  • Lead product launches and develop go-to-market strategies, including positioning, messaging, and marketing collateral.
  • Conduct product training for internal teams, sales representatives, and external partners.
  • Monitor product adoption, usage metrics, and customer feedback to identify areas for improvement and optimize product performance.

Product Performance Analysis and Optimization:

  • Track key product performance metrics, such as revenue, conversion rates, and customer satisfaction, and analyze data to identify opportunities for optimization.
  • Conduct A/B testing and user research to gather insights and validate product enhancements.
  • Continuously iterate and improve product features and experiences based on user feedback and market dynamics.

How Your Work Impacts The Organization

At Fidelity, we are focused on making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want— from the 23 million people investing their life savings, to the 20,000 businesses managing their employee benefits programs, to the10,000 advisors and institutions needing innovative technology solutions to invest their clients’ money. To do this well, as a privately held company, we place a high degree of value in nurturing a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our commitment to being an employer of choice.

Underneath this stable and trusted brand is one of the most interesting innovation practices you never heard of - The Fidelity Center of Applied Technology (‘FCAT”). FCAT is a centralized function whose mandate is to catalyze innovation across the firm. Our FCAT teams prototype and pilot new businesses and capabilities that continue to distinguish our brand as the best customer experience in the financial services industry. These teams focus on exploring big industry game-changing technologies such as crypto currencies, artificial intelligence, virtual/augmented reality & cloud computing. Role

You will do this by learning from customers, partners, compete and our deployment ecosystem collecting product insights and driving those insights into Product Engineering to continuously improve our products.

The Purview CxE (Customer Experience Engineering) Scale Enablement Team is looking for an experienced Product Manager to improve Microsoft Purview products by enabling other internal scale teams to onboard customers to our services, drive adoption, deliver top-notch customer experience, and most importantly drive a data-driven customer/engineering feedback loop to continuously improve our products.

You will engage with customers to deeply understand their needs and synthesize them into actionable roadmaps and product plans to grow usage and improve Microsoft Purview.

To be successful in this role, you are customer obsessed, possess a growth mindset, have excellent analytical skills, and pay tremendous attention to detail. You must have a passion for content creation and be willing to educate the field on best practices and product use. You thrive in an environment where the goal is to make our products easier to use and easier for customers to implement in their organizations. In addition, you have a can-do attitude and strong written and verbal communication. You are a fast learner and drive efficiency through use if AI, Copilots and automation.

Introduction

At IBM, work is more than a job - its a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things youve never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the worlds most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities

As a Product Manager for IBM Securitys QRadar threat detection and response portfolio, youll be responsible for identifying customer needs, qualifying opportunity, and translating those into business requirements. Maintaining a strong, outside-in perspective is essential. You will connect with customers, prospects, and other market stakeholders to discuss their needs, validate market requirements, and share the product vision.

You are expected to manage the offering roadmap, create sales enablement assets, demonstrate the product, and facilitate cross-discipline teamwork.

You are curious - you have a obsession with understanding the who, the what, and the why - and you able to work with development, architecture, and design to help create the how. You may not have all the answers, but you know how to think critically to help find out.   • Proven track record in working effectively with cross-functional groups.

What Leading At Adobe Means


At Adobe, we’re passionate about developing leaders at all levels of the organization from individual contributors to people managers. Anyone who’s considering a career with us should know that we evaluate leadership based on these five capabilities:


  • Demonstrating Strong EQ (Be Aware) – Having a keen sense of self awareness is the foundation of leadership at Adobe. As a leader, we look to you to inspire teams to greatness with empathy and mindfulness of your impact on others from interns to the Board of Directors. And whether you’re in headquarters, New York, London, Tokyo or Bangalore, you’re attuned to emotional, situational and cultural surroundings and adapt your approach accordingly.
  • Selecting Talent (Be a Recruiter) – You’re on top of current and future talent needs as the business evolves because one of your key goals is to build high performing teams. You do so by adopting a rigorous approach to hiring superior talent and are intentionally inclusive to attract diversity of ideas and experiences.
  • Role Modeling Check-In (Be a Coach) – We don’t believe in annual reviews and rankings. That’s why, feedback flows continually at Adobe. You’re an inspirational and effective coach; a leader who discusses expectations, feedback and development regularly with your direct reports. To succeed in this role, you’ll need to address performance gaps early and effectively, and be open to seeking feedback from others to improve your performance and your team’s.
  • Leading Change (Be an Agent of Change) – Change leadership is what you do! You proactively identify opportunities to align team goals with organizational change. You’re great at building support for change because you communicate with conviction and you help those around you to see both the rational and mechanics for business changes and how to adapt accordingly.
  • Scaling the Business (Be an Owner) – You’re someone who sees and understands the vision of the company. You’re able to articulate business strategy and develop business processes, systems and structures to make performance sustainable. Your mission is to deliver an exceptional customer experience by promoting shared goals and driving accountability.

About Zscaler

Zscaler (NASDAQ: ZS) accelerates digital transformation so that customers can be more agile, efficient, resilient, and secure. The Zscaler Zero Trust Exchange is the company’s cloud-native platform that protects thousands of customers from cyberattacks and data loss by securely connecting users, devices, and applications in any location.

With more than 10 years of experience developing, operating, and scaling the cloud, Zscaler serves thousands of enterprise customers around the world, including 450 of the Forbes Global 2000 organizations. In addition to protecting customers from damaging threats, such as ransomware and data exfiltration, it helps them slash costs, reduce complexity, and improve the user experience by eliminating stacks of latency-creating gateway appliances.

Zscaler was founded in 2007 with a mission to make the cloud a safe place to do business and a more enjoyable experience for enterprise users. Zscaler’s purpose-built security platform puts a company’s defenses and controls where the connections occur—the internet—so that every connection is fast and secure, no matter how or where users connect or where their applications and workloads reside.

Mode of work: Hybrid or remote.

Responsibilities

  • Product Strategy & Vision: Define and drive the product roadmap for ZPA platform capabilities for secure remote access, identity and security use cases in alignment with company objectives and customer needs.
  • Product Lifecycle Management: Writing clear and detailed requirements. Work with your team to manage the entire product lifecycle, from ideation to end-of-life, ensuring that products meet and exceed customer expectations.
  • Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, UX/design, and System Engineering teams to solve complex customer problems. Work closely with sales, marketing, and customer success teams to bring products to market and ensure their success.
  • Internal Advocacy: Act as the internal subject matter expert, providing training and support to sales and other teams.
  • Customer Engagement: Directly engage with customers to understand their challenges, gather product feedback, and identify new opportunities.
  • Market Analysis: Conduct competitor analysis and stay abreast of the latest trends in expansion and integration opportunities for zero trust private application access.


Qualifications

  • Experience: 7-10 years of relevant experience in product management, with a significant focus on secure access or cybersecurity.
  • Technical Proficiency: Strong understanding and technical foundation in policy and network security technologies (e.g., VPN, Zero Trust Security (ZTNA), Public Cloud, Networking Technologies , Authentication and Identity.). Familiarity with cloud-based security solutions, especially Zscalers offerings, is a plus.
  • Leadership: Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams and drive results.
  • Customer-centric: Strong customer engagement skills with a knack for understanding and translating customer needs into product requirements.
  • Analytical Mindset: Ability to analyze complex problems, draw relevant conclusions, and devise appropriate strategies.
  • Communication: Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex topics clearly and effectively.


Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. A Master’s or MBA is a plus.

A Product Manager plays a critical role in guiding the development and success of software products or services. They are responsible for defining the products vision, strategy, and roadmap, as well as ensuring that the development team creates a product that meets customer needs and aligns with the companys goals. Heres a detailed job description for a Product Manager:

Job Title: Principal Product Manager

Job Summary: As a Product Manager for software development, you will be responsible for the overall success of a software product or service. You will act as the bridge between business stakeholders, customers, and the development team, overseeing the products entire lifecycle from ideation to launch and beyond. Your role will involve defining the product vision, setting priorities, and ensuring that the development team delivers a high-quality product that meets customer needs and drives business growth.

Key Responsibilities:

Product Strategy:

  • Define and communicate a clear product vision, strategy, and goals.
  • Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify opportunities and threats.
  • Align the product roadmap with company objectives and customer requirements.

Product Roadmap and Planning:

  • Create and maintain a product roadmap that outlines feature development and release schedules.
  • Prioritize features and enhancements based on business value, user feedback, and market trends.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, and marketing, to execute the roadmap.

User-Centered Design:

  • Understand user needs and create user stories, personas, and use cases.
  • Work closely with UX/UI designers to ensure an intuitive and user-friendly product.
  • Conduct usability testing and gather user feedback to refine the product.

Development Team Collaboration:

  • Act as the product owner in an Agile or Scrum development environment.
  • Work with development teams to clarify requirements, provide guidance, and ensure on-time delivery.
  • Remove roadblocks and make trade-off decisions when needed.

Product Launch and Marketing:

  • Plan and execute product launches, including feature announcements and marketing strategies.
  • Collaborate with the marketing team to create product collateral and promotional materials.
  • Monitor product performance and gather user feedback post-launch.

Performance Analysis:

  • Define key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the products success.
  • Analyze data and user feedback to make data-driven decisions and drive continuous improvement.
  • Make adjustments to the product strategy and roadmap as needed.

Stakeholder Communication:

  • Communicate product updates and progress to internal stakeholders and executives.
  • Act as a liaison between the development team and business stakeholders, ensuring alignment on priorities and goals.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelors degree in a related field (e.g., Computer Science, Business, or Engineering). MBA or advanced degree is a plus.
  • Proven experience as a Product Manager in software development with 12+yrs experience
  • Strong understanding of software development methodologies (Agile, Scrum, etc.).
  • Excellent communication, leadership, and teamwork skills.
  • Analytical and data-driven mindset.
  • Proficiency in project management and product management tools.
  • Knowledge of the software development lifecycle and technologies is preferred.

A Product Manager in Software Development plays a pivotal role in shaping the success of software products and services. They must balance business objectives with customer needs and have the ability to lead cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality software products that drive growth and customer satisfaction.

Position Summary...

Demonstrates up-to-date expertise and applies this to the development, execution, and improvement of action plans by providing expert advice and guidance to others in the application of information and best practices; supporting and aligning efforts to meet customer and business needs; and building commitment for perspectives and rationales. Provides and supports the implementation of business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders; identifying business needs; determining and carrying out necessary processes and practices; monitoring progress and results; recognizing and capitalizing on improvement opportunities; and adapting to competing demands, organizational changes, and new responsibilities. Models compliance with company policies and procedures and supports company mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity by incorporating these into the development and implementation of business plans; using the Open Door Policy; and demonstrating and assisting others with how to apply these in executing business processes and practices.

Senior Product Manager (EMXO Prime & CFX), Amazon Prime

Description

Across Emerging Markets (8 countries across APAC, MENA and LATAM), Amazon has an opportunity to engage the next 500MM customers and build a $100B GMS profitable business in the next 3 years. To tap in to this large opportunity, the EMXO Prime and Customer Fulfilment org is building extensible EM first solutions to drive Prime program product strategy and Improve Fulfillment Convenience for customers while reducing overall Cost to Serve. The aim is to drive greater leverage for EMs by advocating for collective EM needs as an extension of WW teams, and selectively invest behind customer outcomes (specific metric) across EMs as global owners.

As the EMXO org structure combines EMXO Program STLs, dedicated PMs and Tech, working closely with Regional SMEs, and In-Country Programs/Operations, the success of the org depends on how each of these teams function coherently to support operational thinking and execution, and prioritize investments that lift collective EM performance. To translate this on ground, we are looking for a highly motivated leader for the role of Senior Product Manager (PM) to the EMXO Prime and CFX org leader. The leader will be responsible for defining and executing initiatives and mechanisms to ensure coordination, visibility, standardization, optimization and enabling of all the efforts across various programs, countries and teams within the EMXO. The PM will improve how teams align/interact to achieve the aggregate long-term impact (3YF), while ensuring short term (OP) country priorities are met by partnering effectively with all levels of leadership, building consensus, influencing organizational priorities and bringing clarity to complexity. This individual must have a high business and technical acumen. Success in this role requires deep understanding of local teams and their work combined with the understanding of how individual teams fit into the EMXO context.

Key job responsibilities

Description

About Target:

As a Fortune 50 company with more than 350k team members worldwide, Target is an iconic brand and one of Americas leading retailers.

Working at Target means the opportunity to help all families discover the joy of everyday life. Caring for our communities is woven into who we are, and we invest in the places we collectively live, work and play.

We prioritise relationships, fuel and develop talent by creating growth opportunities, and succeed as one Target team. At our core, our purpose is ingrained in who we are, what we value, and how we work. It’s how we care, grow, and win together.

About The TEAM

Right along with Target’s distinctive retail brand, we are constantly improving and innovating our digital shopping experience. Are you ready to excel in the fast-changing retail environment? Are you a customer service enthusiast who’s curious about the guest and can see the shopping journey through their eyes? Then you’ll have success on the Digital Strategy & Platform team, whose goal is to offer guests a seamless online shopping experience across our platforms—including Target.com and the store network’s fulfilment capabilities. Here, you’ll collaborate to create and implement the digital strategies that enrich the online experience through the right mix of personalisation, simplicity, and intuitiveness. Your ideas will support Target in complementing the beloved in-store shopping interaction with a convenient, reliable, and instantly gratifying digital experience. 

About The Job

As a Sr. Product Manager for Relevancy Analytics, you will play a pivotal role in the creation and evolution of our relevancy analytics platform and its visualisation interfaces. You will work closely with enterprise data teams and analysts, collaborating and innovating to develop and optimize data dashboards that will transform our search analytics capabilities. Your expertise in Business Intelligence or analytics will be critical in identifying and capitalizing on new opportunities to enhance our search analytics, making it more comprehensive, insightful, and ultimately, more impactful. Beyond the technical scope, you will function as a thought leader within the product team, promoting the value and power of data in driving strategic decisions and influencing product directions.

Your role extends to leading integration efforts with our Target Relevancy Analytical Platform for organizational level analytics and reporting. You will be integral to the Findability Product, Data Science, and Data Analyst organizations, fostering partnerships that will enable the creation of a robust, scalable, and flexible pipeline. This pipeline is vital in supporting the growth of our Findability portfolio. Your responsibility includes identifying strategic opportunities, ensuring alignment, and driving execution across the organization. Your contributions will be instrumental in shaping the future of our search relevancy analytics, supporting our mission to provide more accurate, relevant, and personalized guest experiences.

As a Senior Product Manager, you will work in the product model and will partner to develop a comprehensive product strategy, related roadmap, and set key business objectives (OKRs) for your respective product. You will need to leverage the knowledge of your product, as well as, customer feedback and establish other relevant data points to assess value, develop business cases, and prioritise the direction and desired outcomes for your product. You will lead a product and work in unison with engineers, UX designers, data scientists and business partners to deliver a product.

You will be the “voice of the product” to key stakeholders to ensure that their needs are met and that the product team is getting the direction and support that it needs to be successful. You will develop and actively understand the market, maintain a product roadmap and backlog outlining the customer themes, epics, and stories while prioritising the backlog to focus on the highest impact work for your team and stakeholders.

You will encourage the open exchange of information and viewpoints as well as inspire others to achieve challenging goals and high standards of performance while committing to the organizations direction. You will foster sense of urgency to achieve goals and leverage resources to overcome unexpected obstacles and partner with product teams across the organization to help them achieve their goals while pursuing and completing yours.

Core responsibilities of this job are described within this job description. Job duties may change at any time due to business needs.

  • Strong communication skills, including ability to facilitate communication between business and technology teams
  • Experience working in an agile environment (e.g. user stories, iterative development, scrum teams, sprints, personas)
  • Proven ability to lead a body of work with cross functional partners
  • Demonstrated experience working in a product model using industry best practices
  • Strong analytical, problem solving, and decision making skills leveraging data
  • Strong business, technology and data acumen skills

About Unilever

Be part of the world’s most successful, purpose-led business. Work with brands that are well-loved around the world, that improve the lives of our consumers and the communities around us. We promote innovation, big and small, to make our business win and grow; and we believe in business as a force for good. Unleash your curiosity, challenge ideas and disrupt processes; use your energy to make this happen. Our brilliant business leaders and colleagues provide mentorship and inspiration, so you can be at your best. Every day, nine out of ten Indian households use our products to feel good, look good and get more out of life – giving us a unique opportunity to build a brighter future.

Every individual here can bring their purpose to life through their work. Join us and you’ll be surrounded by inspiring leaders and supportive peers. Among them, you’ll channel your purpose, bring fresh ideas to the table, and simply be you. As you work to make a real impact on the business and the world, we’ll work to help you become a better you.

About Uniops

Unilever Operations (UniOps) is the global technology and operations engine of Unilever offering business services, technology, and enterprise solutions. UniOps serves over 190 locations and through a network of specialized service lines and partners delivers insights and innovations, user experiences and end-to-end seamless delivery making Unilever Purpose Led and Future Fit.

UniOps’ purpose unleashes the power of people, experiences, technology, data, and performance to deliver experiences that grow, fuel, and protect Unilever and our stakeholders.

The Data and Analytics (D&A) team plays a critical role in driving Unilever’s Growth and Fuel for Growth, empowering our people to make smarter and faster decisions to unlock value. Our vision is to transform Unilever to become truly Data Intelligent, delivering superior performance through data-driven decisions.

About D&A – Context And Vision

Digital technology is transforming business, creating huge amounts of data. Our belief is that those companies that can truly harness data and deploy analytics at scale, will be those that succeed in the future.

Our vision is to elevate data and data use across Unilever, to transform Unilever into a Data-Intelligent enterprise, where every decision and action is powered by the best data and advanced analytics (AI) to deliver on our business goals. It’s about empowering our employees, helping them to make smarter and faster decisions and freeing up their capacity to focus on growth and the decisions that matter. Decisions about our categories, brands, channels, key markets, and our people.

We are helping to lead Unilever into the Future of Work, combining the best of human intelligence and machine through data-intelligent decision-making.

Who We Are And What We Do

We are a passionate team of over 350 data experts, data scientists, information experts, technical specialists, and business analysts. We operate as ‘One D&A’, made up of Global engagement and expertise teams, based in our key hubs including India, the UK, and US, and local UniOps in Market D&A teams, based in our key markets. Together, we combine the best of global for scale and efficiency, and local for intimacy and impact.

‘We are in the midst of a paradigm shift where the intelligence of machines will complement human ingenuity to do good, do better and smarter” – Sanjiv Mehta, Unilever President, South Asia

Our Key Objectives As D&A Are To

Set the Unilever data strategy and lay the foundations to maximise the value of our data . Deliver the connected Data Platform to accelerate access to integrated and trusted data at scale across the company for analytics and decisions . Embed core data and analytics capabilities, leading to automation, AI, and Big Data to boost Unilever’s decision intelligence. Lead the Data and Analytics Culture to build a future-fit workforce that values and adopts data-intelligent decision-making across all levels.

We are also passionate about powering our growth with purpose, building a diverse and inclusive team and culture, for example through our #WomenInData program, and continuing to innovate in the use of data and AI to meet our sustainability goals.

Role Profile

As a part of the DaaP Delivery team, the delivery manager role will be responsible for shaping and implementing all the DaaP strategies, leveraging expertise in architecture design, Microsoft Azure, OpenAI, Python, and Databricks. You will work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to deliver innovative DataOps, Gen AI solutions that drive business success.

  • Design Solutions and implement generative AI models and algorithms, utilizing state-of-the-art techniques such as GPT, VAE, and GANs.
  • Work on integrating the cloud GenAI algorithms like ChatGPT, Bard, PaLM etc.
  • Design and develop AI web application using python and organization approved large language models
  • Prompt Engineering for Gen AI algorithms
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define AI project requirements and objectives, ensuring alignment with overall business goals and providing standard building block architecture
  • Research the latest advancements in generative AI, machine learning, and deep learning techniques, and identify opportunities to integrate them into our products and services.
  • Optimize & fine tune existing generative AI models for improved performance, scalability, and efficiency.

Key Accountabilities

  • Identify innovative solutions with new and/or existing toolsets to deliver cost-effective, efficient, robust, and resilient solutions to DaaP. Engage with Technology Counterparts and scout external markets for cutting-edge solutions in the market.
  • Own innovation in solutions within the platform. Deliver purposeful innovation in solutions, processes, and controls.
  • Maximize Benefits, sweat assets, identify unused capabilities within toolset and maintain optimal utilization of features against capital invested on assets / licenses.
  • Provide technical expertise and guidance in AI/ML technologies and methodologies to the Technical Architects and ML engineers.
  • Design and develop AI application using python, langchain, python web framework, large language models like GPT (Azure OpenAI), Llama2, Google VertexAI etc.
  • Need to stay up to date with the latest advancements in the field of AI-ML ,Data Science and Data Analytics and also guide the team in applying best practices and innovative solutions.
  • Drive research activities to explore new AI/ML technologies, techniques and processes.
  • Should be able to collaborate with cross-functional teams, sales and pre-sales team, and business stakeholders, to understand requirements, align priorities, and drive the integration of AI/ML solutions into services
  • Ensure the quality and performance of AI/ML models, systems, and algorithms.
  • Contribute to the development of AI/ML strategy and roadmaps aligned with business goals.

Vendor and cross platform team engagement

  • Engage with Third Party Vendor teams.
  • Setting up and managing the governance mechanisms for vendor delivery including periodic reviews and meetings as per the defined governance mechanism.
  • Partner with Suppliers to implement actions for continuous improvement of service and proactive actions.

All About You

Essential Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering or Masters in computer applications.
  • 7+ years of experience in building, and delivering ML/AI workloads on the Cloud (preferably Azure)
  • Hands-on Python coding experience with exposure to CI/CD and git hub etc
  • Experience in Azure data factory, Data bricks .
  • Experience in architecting and designing scalable data warehouses & AI solutions
  • Exposure to Retail and CPG industry is a plus.
  • Powerful analytical skills which allow to evaluate problems, attention to detail, critical thinking ability to analyse problems and reach solution and take informed decisions.
  • Experience in working with geographically diverse teams.

Desirable Experience

  • Experience in BI and Data Warehousing
  • Working knowledge of Azure Cloud

Key Skills Required

Professional Skills (foundation/practitioner/mentor)

  • Project Delivery management principles - Practitioner
  • Gen AI - Practitioner
  • Data Warehousing - Practitioner
  • Coding - Practitioner
  • Analytics Solution Design - Practitioner
  • Data lifecycle management – Foundation

Leadership Skills

  • Demonstrates strong "Inner game":
    • Strong Design Thinking/Agility and innovation mindset – intellectually curious, constantly looking to develop, embraces change with a sense of urgency and enjoys positively challenging status quo
    • Personal drive and ability to inspire and engage others towards action.
    • Personal mastery –emotionally resilient; always bringing the best of themselves.
  • Demonstrates great "Outer game":
    • Credible business acumen – shows an understanding of business, commercials and performance metrics. Has gravitas to effectively influence senior stakeholder within a functional and business context
    • Encourages experimentation, bringing the outside in, and intelligent risk taking
    • Brings the voice of the consumer and internal customer into everything they do
    • Passion for high performance – creating motivation and focus to drive execution at speed

Product Manager, Cloud Migration

We are looking for a Product Manager to join the Cloud Products team at Flexera. If you have deep understanding of product management, technology trends, and a proven track record of creating product solutions for management/modernization/migration in Public Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP, …) and/or containers (Kubernetes, OpenShift, EKS, AKS, GKE, …) then we need you.

You will be responsible for understanding and refining user requirements, defining a roadmap for your product area and executing on it. Your day-to-day activities will include customer and market research, communicating with customers, engineering, product, and internal stakeholders, working with architects and user experience engineers on high level designs for your features.

Critical in this role will be your ability to manage incoming feature requests and priorities, participate in roadmap planning, develop business case justifications for new capabilities and feature enhancements, develop user stories, conduct customer interviews and manage customer interactions during design and implementation process.

Desired Experience

  • Familiar with building products intended for key IT functions in large organizations like Public Clouds Management, Cloud Migration, Digital Transformation, IT Asset Management, IT Service Management, and IT Financial Management.
  • Practical knowledge of what it takes to architect & build a successful SaaS application.
  • Working with customers to understand their needs and the business value they need to see from a feature.
  • Working with internal audiences (sales, marketing, etc.) and Sales enablement.
  • Capacity management experience or working with tools in the space.
  • Points for expert knowledge in one or more of the following subjects: FinOps, public cloud IaaS/PaaS catalogs, public cloud console & APIs/CLI, Business Service dependency mapping, CMDB, public cloud cost optimization, container environment management, ITAM, SAM.

Desired Skills

  • Problem-solving skills going from the customer to how the technology works with ability to quickly translate customer opportunity or need into product and technology requirements.
  • Strong strategic thinking, able to translate the companys strategic direction into a concrete plan.
  • Ability to innovate with an understanding of how to take ideas forward through strong influence skills - build relationships and evangelize strategy & plan well (verbally and written).
  • Deep empathy for customers and focus on user-centric experiences.
  • Experience with agile software development methods and dev-ops processes.
  • Comfortable with ambiguity; self-starter and purpose driven; have a strong sense of curiosity.
  • Ability to communicate with and align around technical strategies with architects and product owners.
  • Able to break down customer needs to product components, features, and technologies.
  • Be comfortable in front of customers and be able to build relationships.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelors degree; education concentrated in business or technology fields is preferred.
  • 5+ years of experience in a product manager or product owner role, preferably in enterprise SaaS or mid-market digital products.
  • Experience with enterprise solutions targeting Global 5000 customers.
  • Experience working in matrix organization influencing work in different functions of user experience design and software development.

Product Area Focus

During digital transformation, you have important decisions to make, such as determining top external-facing applications and whether they have greater business impact if moved to the cloud. Visibility into applications across the IT landscape and their interdependencies combined with high quality data is needed to plan a successful cloud migration with confidence and make efficient use of cloud resources.

Flexera helps customers to plot the best course for modernizing IT infrastructure by addressing the following needs:

  • View how IT application dependencies impact business services.
  • Determine the total cost of public, private and hybrid clouds hosting scenarios.
  • Gain full visibility into workloads for successful cloud migration.

Job Description

Role: Data Migration Analyst

Shift: UK – Work from Office

‎ Location: Bangalore

Job Summary –

We are looking for Data migration Analyst, to engage with passionate Data Analyst with an ability to turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.

Responsibilities

 Works with customers in gathering business requirements for data migration needs.

 Works across multiple functional projects to understand data usage and implications for data migration.

 Assists in designing, planning, and managing the data migration processes.

 Works with subject matter experts and project team to identify, define, collate, structure, document and communicate the data migration requirements.

 Prepares data migration plans including migration risks, milestones, quality and business sign-off details.

 Manages assigned risks and monitor potential impacts as part of the data migration plan.

 Develops robust QA models, best practice, processes, and standards based on experience gathered for effectively carrying out data migration activities.

 Performs source system data analysis in order to manage source to target data mapping.

 Performs migration and testing of static data and transaction data from one core system to another.

 Performs data migration audit, reconciliation, and exception reporting.

 Manages cross-program data assurance for physical data items in source and target systems.

Are You Up To The Challenge?

As a Lead Product Manager in the Mobile Publishing team you’ll be responsible for ensuring the games you work on are commercially successful. You’ll be working closely with our development partners, data science & marketing teams to ensure games have their best chance at success.

Your Team Mates

The Mobile Publishing team works with external game developers to bring their titles to success by leveraging the internal expertise of Kwalee. We source and onboard developers and provide a suite of tools through our publishing portal to support them at every step of the journey. Our team comprises of Business Development who source new games, Partnerships who nurture our long term relationships, Production who ensure games are of the highest quality, and Technology who build the technology that supports our partners.

What Does The Job Actually Involve?

  • Working collaboratively with disciplines across external development and publishing to help make sure our games are a commercial success
  • Helping analyse early-stage testing data to justify more feature work on a concept or advocate moving on

  • Willingness to drive results and deadlines based on targets and KPIs

  • Passion for games and knowledge of industry trends and key players
  • Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with excellent interpersonal skills

Your Soft Skills

Kwalee has grown fast in recent years but we’re very much a family of colleagues. We welcome people of all ages, races, colours, beliefs, sexual orientations, genders and circumstances, and all we ask is that you collaborate, work hard, ask questions and have fun with your team and colleagues.

A Little More About Kwalee

The Team: epocrates is seeking a Product Manager for our data and content management platform that powers the user experience. Job Responsibilities

The Product Manager is responsible for developing the vision and roadmap for a complex data and content platform product while also working with stakeholders to build the product. This is a rare opportunity to build a core platform from the ground up, from conceptualizing to planning to execution.

This is a great role for someone with mid-level experience in product management who is looking to advance their career by owning a large complex platform from end to end. This role will allow you to work with SMEs who have deep experience in the healthcare area, experienced engineering teams, and application product managers and engineers who will rely on your work. Additionally, you will get the opportunity to deep dive into our proprietary knowledge graph.

A CMS platform product manager is a highly challenging and impactful role. They are responsible for prioritizing and supporting the work of multiple consumer-facing products while managing the back-end work associated with it. With that, we are seeking a fast-learning, open-minded, problem-solving product manager, who excels at working with multiple stakeholders while thinking independently. Because this is a platform that will have long-term impact to our business, the candidate needs to have the passion to think big into the future and have the patience to take care of detailed feature implementation. The candidate is not afraid to make difficult tradeoff decisions and is able to effectively communicate them to stakeholders.

  • Product Vision and Roadmap: You will work with stakeholders to envision a data and content management platform that serves current requirements as well as future needs. You will build a roadmap that maps to a multi-year reality and to a quarterly delivery plan.
  • Product Manager: You will work directly with a dedicated scrum team in the Product Manager role to prioritize the team’s work and ensure the products that are built are the products you envision. In addition, you will own the care and maintenance of our existing content manage tool, including triaging/prioritizing any production defects or other external demands for incorporation into the roadmap as necessary. 
  • Product Evangelist: You will be the face of the platform to gain buy-in across the organization for your vision and roadmap, communicate tradeoffs, promote launches, and celebrate team wins.

 

Typical Qualifications 

  • 4-6 years product management experience.
  • Experience bringing at least one major platform product successfully to market HIGHLY preferred. 
  • Sufficient technical understanding of data products and uniqueness of platform products to effectively navigate tradeoffs, understand technical investments, discuss best practices. 
  • Excellent understanding of product management best practices, including working within agile development environments.
  • Strong negotiation and problem-solving skills, with energy & enthusiasm for solving unknowns
  • Strong analytic and quantitative capabilities. You have a data-driven mindset, but pragmatic approach to your work.
  • Experience with long term planning for growth and scalability based on high level initiatives
  • Strong strategic mindset to prioritize stakeholder requirements against engineering efficiencies
  • Excellent organization to document approaches and present decisions with risks & benefits to leadership
  • Skilled at creating user stories that list clear details and acceptance criteria to cover all edge cases
  • Basic technical understanding to review data flow architecture and the publishing process

About Athenahealth

Here’s our vision: To create a thriving ecosystem that delivers accessible, high-quality, and sustainable healthcare for all. 

What’s unique about our locations?

From an historic, 19th century arsenal to a converted, landmark power plant, all of athenahealth’s offices were carefully chosen to represent our innovative spirit and promote the most positive and productive work environment for our teams. Our 10 offices across the United States and India — plus numerous remote employees — all work to modernize the healthcare experience, together.

Our Company Culture Might Be Our Best Feature.

We dont take ourselves too seriously. But our work? That’s another story. athenahealth develops and implements products and services that support US healthcare: It’s our chance to create healthier futures for ourselves, for our family and friends, for everyone.

Our vibrant and talented employees — or athenistas, as we call ourselves — spark the innovation and passion needed to accomplish our goal. We continue to expand our workforce with amazing people who bring diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives at every level, and foster an environment where every athenista feels comfortable bringing their best selves to work.

Our size makes a difference, too: We are small enough that your individual contributions will stand out — but large enough to grow your career with our resources and established business stability.

Giving back is integral to our culture. Our athenaGives platform strives to support food security, expand access to high-quality healthcare for all, and support STEM education to develop providers and technologists who will provide access to high-quality healthcare for all in the future. As part of the evolution of athenahealth’s Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) program, we’ve selected nonprofit partners that align with our purpose and let us foster long-term partnerships for charitable giving, employee volunteerism, insight sharing, collaboration, and cross-team engagement.  

What can we do for you?

Along with health and financial benefits, athenistas enjoy perks specific to each location, including commuter support, employee assistance programs, tuition assistance, employee resource groups, and collaborative workspaces — some offices even welcome dogs.

In addition to our traditional benefits and perks, we sponsor events throughout the year, including book clubs, external speakers, and hackathons. And we provide athenistas with a company culture based on learning, the support of an engaged team, and an inclusive environment where all employees are valued.

We also encourage a better work-life balance for athenistas with our flexibility. While we know in-office collaboration is critical to our vision, we recognize that not all work needs to be done within an office environment, full-time. With consistent communication and digital collaboration tools, athenahealth enables employees to find a balance that feels fulfilling and productive for each individual situation.

Sr Product Manager- Search and Real-Time Analytics Platform

About The Role

Join Ubers team as a Product Manager and shape the future of our critical Search and Real-time Analytics platform. Drive vision, strategy, and execution for systems powering millions of daily trips, global delivery orders, and location searches. Elevate the user experience, enable data-driven insights, and support vital business functions through fast, reliable, and scalable data solutions.

The mission of the team is to provide fast and reliable data at low latencies at scale to enable MagicalUserExperinces for our riders, drivers, eaters, couriers, Ads businesses, SMBs, and large enterprise businesses, and enable a healthy marketplace globally. Search volumes at Uber have grown exceptionally and Ubers business relies heavily on these rich data sets to gain deep insights and to make real-time decisions and balance marketplace supply.

As a product manager, you will help define and own pieces of the platform strategy, drive requirements and deliver products that power intelligence at Uber. You will create and own systems that enable end-to-end Search and real-time analytics solutions from ingestions to storage to stateful serving and ROI analysis. You work closely with world-class product and engineering teams, technical program managers, data scientists, and designers and collaborate with nearly every aspect of the Uber organization. Your impact and success will change the course of the Search and real-time analytics platform at Uber and create a world-class product suite that supports our unprecedented growth for our customers and business.

Having excellent communication and collaboration skills, an entrepreneurial bent, technical and analytical understanding, product management expertise, good judgment and deep background in building scalable systems would allow you to thrive in this role.

What The Candidate Will Need / Bonus Points

---- What the Candidate Will Do ----

  • Internalize and deeply understand Ubers mission and strategy, as well as the mission and goals of the Search and real-time platform teams and partner teams you work with.
  • Collaborate with top-tier Engineering teams, Front-end Product Managers, Data Scientists, TPMs, and Designers to develop and refine the backend platform supporting Ubers Search products.
  • Obsess over making the platform Self-serve, while being highly observable and attributable, to enable Product teams to onboard and manage use cases seamlessly and the platform can monitor usage behavior and optimize for growth and scale.
  • Engage with multiple facets of the Uber ecosystem - from Rider to Driver systems, from Maps to Marketplace, and from Eats to Couriers, Ads, and others.
  • Gather requirements, identify user pain points and opportunities, and make key prioritization decisions.
  • Build and own a cohesive product vision, strategy, and roadmap for the backend support systems of the Global Search and real-time analytics platform. Make trade-off decisions based on technical and business insights and manage internal and external stakeholders
  • Monitor and measure product launches and feed insights back into the product development process.
  • Set qualitative objectives and quantitative goals (OKRs, KPI, and measurements)
  • Understand and embrace the intricate details of how the backend platform affects Ubers core business and align your teams objectives and roadmap with this knowledge.
  • Execute with a bias towards action, grounding decisions in data, maintaining a keen eye for detail, and fostering strong inter-team relationships. Always prioritize the customer and iterate rapidly to achieve excellence.
  • Envision the future with LLMs and Vector Databases as Search is core to high-quality output. Strategize and build todays systems that will become pivotal assets tomorrow.
  • Communicate product plans, progress, and results to a wide range of audiences, from internal stakeholders to customer teams, Uber executives, and external data engineering blogs and open-source communities
  • Lead by example, be incredibly data-driven, and set a high bar for the team to think boldly and creatively, then convert that energy into concrete products and execution plans. Be in the detail, and knowledgeable of your teams work in depth.

---- Basic Qualifications ----

---- What the Candidate Will Do ----

About Highspot

Highspot is pioneering the category that is fundamentally changing the way companies increase sales productivity. On a mission to transform the way millions of people work with sales enablement, Highspot is committed to building breakthrough software with a spark of magic. We believe a great place to work is about more than the work – it’s about what the company stands for, and how it authentically represents its values in the real world. To this end, we have put intentional focus on creating equitable workspaces for each of our employees. Our goal is to create a culture where everyone feels a deep sense of belonging and is empowered to be an agent of change, with the ability to transform themselves, their workplace, and their world.

About The Role

In this role, you will be joining the Product Management team reporting to the Director of Product Management. The Product Management function at Highspot is an integral part of the company. You will be jumping into many different projects and features, and will be very hands-on. You will be working very closely with design, user research and engineering to think critically and collaboratively about how to solve complex customer problems. Over time, you will have the opportunity to help shape and grow not just the product, but also the team.

The Senior Product Manager role has an area of ownership within the product portfolio, and works with a feature crew of engineers and designers to identify, define, validate, and ship features.

What Youll Do
  • You will work with customers and stakeholders to define a roadmap, problems and requirements, and backlog, then manage them through the product development process from discovery to general availability.
  • You will become an expert on our software, customer, and our market, as well as be able to identify, prioritize and execute on both tactical and strategic projects.
  • You work well cross-functionally with other teams such as executives, product marketing, customer success and make sure their objectives are met, opinions are considered, and plans communicated.
  • You will work with your partner teams in design and engineering, both within your region as well as globally, to ensure that we ship a high quality product, on time, that provides a great experience to our users.
  • You will collect and analyze feedback from customers, stakeholders and other teams to shape requirements, features and end products.
  • You will dig deep into customer and usage data to identify opportunities and evaluate the success of our efforts.

Your Background
  • This is a senior-level position. You have been building software products for some time and have 5+ years of experience shipping products as a PM in an agile / scrum / kanban environment.
  • You are experienced at taking ideas and ambiguous data, defining the right outcome, and then mapping the right roadmap/backlog to get there.
  • You are able to consider and balance the many different data points and opinions about your area of ownership.
  • You can communicate and articulate the strategy and roadmap to execs, team members and customers.
  • This is a technical role, you will be able to work directly with senior engineers and instinctively understand technical concepts and trade-offs.
  • You are able to comfortably handle many concurrent projects and to dos, and instinctively re-prioritize often without needing guidance. Highspot is in the growth/scale stage and you will be comfortable with the level of ambiguity and workload that entails.
  • You have the ability to roll up your sleeves and pick up work outside of your role definition when you need to.
  • You have worked with engineering teams as a product owner and have demonstrable experience leading cross-functional teams to ship high-quality products.
  • You are a strong communicator and can lead teams through difficult decisions.
  • You have strong data skills in quantitative analytics and qualitative user research.

Desired Qualifications
  • You have experience building mobile
  • You have experience managing products for sales, marketing or other customer-facing teams.
  • You have experience in consumer or B2B SaaS and understand the mechanics and economics of a SaaS business.
  • You have a technical degree or equivalent work experience.
